content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is a simple solution to your problem in Julia programming language:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    new_words = String[]
    for word in words
        if first(word) == uppercase(first(word)) && !isempty(word)
            push!(new_words, word)
        end
    end
    return new_words
end
```
In this function `keep_only_names`, we iterate over each word in the provided list of words. If a word starts with an uppercase letter (checked using `first(word) == uppercase(first(word))` and if it is not empty), we push it to a new list called `new_words`. This function finally returns this `new_words` list which contains only the words that start with a capital letter.

You can call this function like:
```julia
words = ["dog", "Dog", "cat", "Cat"]
new_words = keep_only_names(words)
print(new_words)
```
This will output `["Dog", "Cat"]`.
